titleStmt.title: Description of University of Manchester Library, Hebrew MS 25: Deuteronomy

msContents.summary: Originating from the Jewish community of Henan, China, this manuscript contains a section from the Hebrew Bible, i.e. Deuteronomy 1-3:22. One folio with verses 1:33-1:39 is missing.

respStmt.persName: Crawford, James Ludovic Lindsay, Earl of, 1847-1913

msItem.title: Original binding: a softcover made of a large folded folio
Original binding: a softcover made of a large folded folio

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at the top centre of side a of each folio. Pagination in Hebrew letters at the top inner corner (twice 1-21). One folio missing between folios 7 and 8.

layoutDesc.layout: Long line with 7 written lines. Visible dry stylus ruling.

decoDesc.decoNote: Very faint Latin cursive writings on inner soft covers.
Foldout recto (unfolded)Bookplate of the Bibliotheca Lindesiana
Inside back coverBookplate of the Bibliotheca Lindesiana

binding.p: Modern brown leather binding. The binding is larger in size than the original folios. When rebinding the manuscript six flyleaves were added on each side. In addition the original binding was kept (counted as flyleaves in the measures): this is a softcover made of a large folded folio. Bottom of back paste-down leather in small gold letters: FAZAKERLEY LIVERPOOL

origin.p: Produced in the province of Henan, China; eighteenth or nineteenth century

history.provenance: Acquired by Enriqueta Rylands in 1901 from James Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford of Haigh Hall, and later bequeathed to the John Rylands Library.
